clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effects of Spices on Pathways Associated With Glucose Homeostasis and Inflammation on PBMCs of Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects of Spices on Pathways Associated With Glucose Homeostasis, Oxidative Stress and Inflammation in Healthy Subjects - Molecular Insights Through Transcriptomics of Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMC)

collaborator.agency: Food for Health Science Centre, Lund University

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the effect of spices on gene expression of pathways associated with glucose homeostasis, oxidative stress and inflammation, in the postprandial phase in healthy human subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline (0 hr) in untargeted PBMC gene expression profile at 2 hr and 4 hr
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 hr and after intervention at 2 hr and 4 hr.
primary_outcome.description: The venous blood samples will be taken for isolation of peripheral blood mononuclear cells. Extracted total RNA will then be used for running RNA-seq/whole-transcriptome shotgun sequencing (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective appetite ratings using standard subjective 100 mm VAS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 min and after intervention at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180 and 240 min.
secondary_outcome.description: Appetite will be assessed using standard subjective 100 mm VAS (visual analogue scale) at time intervals throughout each visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 min and after intervention at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180 and 240 min.
secondary_outcome.description: The capillary blood samples will be taken for blood glucose analysis. The venous blood samples will be taken for further assessment of insulin, triacylglycerol, NEFA and inflammatory biomarkers (i.e. IL-6, IL-8, CRP)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 min and after intervention at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180 and 240 min.
secondary_outcome.description: Metabolite profile will be analyzed using Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry based methods

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy males and females
- BMI 20-28 kg/m2
- Must be able to accept spices
- Agreed and signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Below 18 years old
- Uncomfortable speaking English and/or difficulties in understanding spoken English
- Smoking or using snuss
- Vegetarian or vegan
- Stressed by venous blood sampling or previous experience of being difficult to be cannulated
- Receiving any drug treatment that may influence the study outcomes
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
